name: Oh Mummy Genesis
description:
Oh Mummy Genesis is an unofficial enhanced remake of Oh Mummy. The player controls one of two adventurers sent to Egypt by the British Museum to collect a set of five royal mummies and all the treasure they can carry. Gameplay takes the form of a single-screen maze game, similar to Pac-Man. Each floor of the dungeon has a grid of sarcophagi; the player must walk a full circle around a sarcophagus to open it, and must collect at least one key and one treasure before moving on to the next level. Unlike the original game, Oh Mummy Genesis features a slightly more involved story and each tomb is capped off with a boss battle.

In addition to the remake, a faithful port of the original Amstrad CPC version of Oh Mummy is also included.

After the initial print run sold out, the game's ROM was made available for free download from its official website.

shot.caption: The game boots to a faux BASIC screen that lets the player choose what version to play.
Oh Mummy Genesis opens with a cutscene providing the remake's new backstory.
Level layouts are accurate to the original game.
Walking around a sarcophagus opens it; there are several different possible contents. The player needs to collect at least a key and one treasure to exit.
There are a few variations on the basic gameplay. This level is filled with water, so the player has to remember their footsteps.
This level is pitch-black; the player can only see eyes to tell player and enemy positions, and closed sarcophagi are inbisible.
The first boss! This sphinx obscures the player's view, and will swoop down to attack.
"Oh Mummy Classic" is an accurate reproduction of the original Amstrad CPC game, complete with a mock loading screen.
The in-game graphics are an accurate reproduction of the original game.
